Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Sandi L. Wisenberg Research Files TAM 582
0.75 Linear Feet (2 boxes)
1980s Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fads Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include including notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera, and a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article. Materials are in English 1-2
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
Sandi L. Wisenberg, journalist and author, was a features writer for the Miami Herald, for which she wrote "Reds: A Generation of American Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach" (July, 21, 1985). Wisenberg also wrote Holocaust Girls: History, Memory and Other Obsessions (2002), and The Adventures of Cancer Bitch (2009). For more biographical information, see her website (http://slwisenberg.blogspot.com/).
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Sandi L. Wisenberg Research Files; TAM 582; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Content Note
The collection contains Wisenberg's reseach files for "Reds: A Generation of Radicals Fades Away on Miami Beach," including files labeled with the first names of the individuals featured. The files include notebooks, drafts, clippings and other printed ephemera. There are also a dozen audiocassettes, principally interviews with the subjects of her article.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection, created by Sandi L. Wisenberg, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Oral histories (document genres) Notebooks. Research notes. Jewish communists -- United States. Jewish communists |z United States |v Interviews. Jewish socialists -- United States. Audiocassettes.
